person.persName: John Charles Frémont (Politician and U.S. major general)

body.p: Savannah, Georgia native. Son of Jean Charles Frémon and Anne Whiting Pryor Frémon. Married Jessie Benton Frémont on October 19, 1841. Attended Charleston College in Charleston, South Carolina from may 1829 to 1831. Teacher on the ship Natchez in 1833. Served in the United States Topographical Corps as second lieutenant. Elected U.S. Senator for California in 1850. Unsuccessful Republican nominee for president in 1856. Served in the U.S. Army as major general from 1861 to 1862.
